channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report X-2024021389
item.description:
Report X-2024021389

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While loading a van a manager found a hazmat that was leaking and notified QA. DescribePack: Upon inspection a loose seal was found under one of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the leak was found QA tightened the lid and packed the box into a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2024021187
item.description:
Report X-2024021187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Delivery driver came back to station with package on his truck. He told me he had a leaking hazmat package. I removed the hazmat package which was in a trash bag to prevent any further contamination. I took hazmat package to hazmat cage and opened it up and determined that inside the package there were 4 gallons of Dishmachine detergent, of which 1 was leaking. DescribePack: The lid on the gallon that was leaking was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I sprinkled Amphomag universal spill neutralizer inside the truck on the small amount that spilled

item.title: Report X-2024021066
item.description:
Report X-2024021066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T00:36:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: NORTH PLATTE
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TILX 197920 was reported to be releasing product from the top of the car. Inspection of the car found the liquid valve open and the closure plug was not installed. Approximately fifteen gallons of product were released with ten gallons reaching the ground.
